item.title: Report X-2025041731
item.description:
Report X-2025041731

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-24T01:00:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-11
  • City: PLAINFIELD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO OF DELAWARE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDERS WERE CALLED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE. A PACKAGE WITH BLEACH WAS DISCOVERED TO HAD LEAKED ON SEVERAL OTHER PACKAGES. UPON RETURNING TO THE CAGE FOR PROCESSING THIS BOX WAS OPENED AND IT WAS FOUND TO HAVE DIAMOND HASMAT STICKERS ON THE INNER BOX WITH NO MARKINGS ON THE EXTERNAL PACKAGE. BOTTLES WERE UNDAMAGED. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBER: 1Z8004F90300271239

item.title: Report X-2025041339
item.description:
Report X-2025041339

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-23T00:57:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-10
  • City: GARY
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: ILLINOIS CENTRAL RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 17000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 04-10-2025 a CN mechanical performing an inbound inspection of train M-33891-09 observed vapor emitting from the valve area of TILX 112000.The employee notified the Dangerous Goods Team and made internal emergency notifications per the CN ERP. The CN Dangerous Goods Officer upon arrival found vapor coming from the air valve. The blind flange was not applied, and the valve was cracked open. The liquid line also had the shipper supplied loading fitting still applied. The fitting did not have a cap on. The air valve was closed, and the blind flange was reapplied. On the liquid line the shippers fitting was removed, and the blind flange was reapplied. The tank cars pressure plate was cleaned by the CN Dangerous Goods Team.

item.title: Report E-2025040556
item.description:
Report E-2025040556

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-23T00:57:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-08
  • City: EVANSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two and a half (2.5) gallons of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the drum leaking. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 20-gallon poly drum. One (1) 90-gallon poly drum was used to contain the damaged 55-gallon drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025040581
item.description:
Report E-2025040581

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-23T00:57:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-27
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately four (4) gallons of material released from eight (8) 3.5-gallon metal pails due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pails being falling. The released material impacted the trailer floor. The material dried to the pails, so no absorbents was necessary. Dayton Freight personnel containerized the damaged pails into four (4) 30-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025040466
item.description:
Report E-2025040466

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-17
  • City: ELKHART
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately twelve (12) gallons of material released from one (1) 55-gallon poly drum due to a manufacturing defect at the bottom of the drum that resulted in the drum leaking. The released material impacted the concrete dock floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged drum was containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

Report X-2025041330

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-05
  • City: GARY
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: ILLINOIS CENTRAL RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 16000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 04-05-2025 a CN mechanical performing an inbound inspection of train M-34241-05 observed frost on the protective housing of tank car # SHPX 222262 along with a strong Propane type odor in the area. The employee notified the Dangerous Goods Team and made internal emergency notifications per the CN ERP. The CN Dangerous Goods Officer upon arrival and inspection found icing on the 2# B end liquid valve. It was found that the valve handle was not in the fully closed position. The plug was also found to be less than tool tight allowing product to leak out. The 2# Vapor valve was also found to be leaking due to the valve handle not being in the fully closed position and the securement plug was less than tool tight. Air monitoring readings on top of the car were below actionable levels with the highest LEL (Lower Explosive Limit) reading sitting at an 8%. PPE was FR Clothing and based on the Air monitoring readings on top of the car no raspatory protection was worn. Both the 2" B end liquid valve and vapor valve were closed stopping the release. The plug was removed allowing the residual product to vent and the valve to thaw. The securement was confirmed with an air monitor which showed non detect. The securement plug was then installed
